text: Nora waits for a shirt to come out of a 3D printer. It’s future, guys.
Hey thanks for the bottle of water. It’s the little touches get you 5 stars. She shows him she rated him 5 stars on her version of Nit (which is like a Tinder/Uber hybrid.)
Cool. Hey, you have time for a quick fuck before work?
I really don’t. Maybe if we get matched up again.
Um, I haven’t rated you yet.
... Really, dude?
I mean, two stars can significantly lower your average... Nora sighs and starts taking off her clothes.
Awesome. Thanks man.
No, you know what? Fuck this. I‘1l take the two.
Too bad, bitch. I gave you a one.

Wow. Okay then, I’1l earn it. She grabs the shirt and heaves the printer in the air, leaving as Byron scrambles to catch it. INT. HALL OUTSIDE BYRON’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS Pulling on her shirt, Nora hears a CRASH and smiles. Her phone dings and she sees a screen: “You have received a 0 star rating on your last Nitely experience. Would you lik to contest, y/n?” She scowls.
“Nathan”

The freeway is full of SELF-DRIVING CARS shaped like eggs INT. NATHAN’S SELF-DRIVING CAR - CONTINUOUS NATHAN BROWN, 27, things come easily to him, especially women, edits lines of computer code projected on windshield/screen. Nathan's best friend/work partner JAIME ARNAZ is on speak
There’s some kind of acceptance bias in the last three lines.
Yeah... what is that?... oh. He hits a few keys.
(tired) Aw yiss. Nailed it. Okay, the AGIP protocol still needs work.
God no. I gotta veg a little. See you later, okay?
Dude, we are so close-- Nathan hangs up, then pokes a key. His work is pushed to side. He decides to have some fun.
Car?
(Australian accent female) Yes, Nathan?
Clean camera lenses please.

Cleaning... Little squirts and wipers go off inside and out. While th car can’t see, Nathan shuts off the car’s brain and hacks something to drive using the keyboard with the W-A-S-D ke He swerves in and out, passing other cars and enjoying th startled looks. After a few seconds, he hears a SIREN.
Uh oh.
Nathan explains out the window.
It just started racing, who knows why. I’11 take it in to be serviced asap, swear to God. REVEAL he’s Facetiming a FEMALE CHP OFFICER on a tablet attached to a hovering DRONE.
I’m on my way to my parent’s house for Thanksgiving -- can you imagine if they were waiting and my car had -- I don’t even want to think about it.
Uh huh. Car, what’s your story?
Don’t know what happened. Lost consciousness for a minute. Will update anti-virus software now.
Yeah, you do that. There’s a human life back here!
Okay, you can go. Get it fixed soon though. I don’t want to see you again.
Oh no...? He smiles at her. She laughs, charmed.
Should I call your long-time girlfriend Ingrid and tell her you will be late? The officer rolls her eyes and flies off.

It’s called being nice. God. INT. NY SUBWAY - FUTURE DECEMBER DAY —- MORNING Ads for the big digital afterlives line the car. (“Experi ‘Ternity’ by Spectrum.” “Apple/Intel’s ‘Cove’” “40% off y first 100 years at Snap-Disney’s ‘Cumulus.’” “You did wel you deserve Lakeview by Amazon.”) Nora, squeezed on a bench, glances at the guy next to her He’s watching a telenovela called “Amor Despues de la Muerte.” A man holds his hand up to a giant screen. On th other side, a woman holds her hand up to touch his. Behin her is a color-saturated Puerto Rico beach resort.
Me estas esperando?
Dije que lo haria. Nora leans closer to the guy’s earbud to listen in. The g turns and kisses her on the mouth. She rubs her lip with sleeve.
Echh. Fucking commuters.
Nora walks down the crowded sidewalk. Drones fly overhead like pigeons. The street is crammed with bikes, one of wh bangs into Nora.
Ow! Fucking bikes!
Nora hurries past protesters, holding signs like “Digital Afterlife is an Abomination to God!”
The Works of Man are Shit!
Fucking Ludds.

Employees touch their index finger to a screen and are allowed to enter. Nora gives the middle finger to the scr then uses it to log in. She walks under a sign reading: “Amazon Lakeview Customer Service.”
An old Tesla Model S (a junker in the future) stops in fr and Jaime runs out. Behind him, the car parks itself.
Jaime lets himself in and rushes to the dining room.
Hey, Mrs. Brown, sorry I’m late-- whoa! He sees Nathan sitting next to INGRID KANNERMAN, 28, blon very beautiful but intense, surrounded by Nathan’s family

Ingrid. What are you -- I mean, am I crashing something? Ingrid nods. Nathan’s Mom, who is smoking a joint, waves his concern. NATHAN’S MOM Pshh, Jaime, you’re always welcome. Nathan, get him a chair.
I'll help.
The fuck?! She always has Thanksgiving with her family.
Invited herself. I didn’t think it was a great idea but she started crying, and I can’t handle crying.
You could have told me she’d be here. I had time to kill myself.
Just drop it, man. She’s my girlfriend now and I love her. Get used to it.
Okay, but if she’s coming to family Thanksgiving, next thing she’s gonna expect is a proposal. Get used to that.
Ingrid holds up a spoon of rice with red berries.
And it’s really called “barbarian stew?” NATHAN’S MOM No, those are “bar-berries.” The dish is Zereshk Pollo. It’s Persian, from my mother’s side.
Ha ahhaa. It is so good. Spicy!  Nathan and Jaime come back in.
So, Ingrid, Nathan says you invited him to your grandma’s 100th birthday? NATHAN’S DAD A hundred! Wow, impressive.
Well, she’s in Heaven. NATHAN’S MOM Oh, which one?
Lakeview. NATHAN’S MOM Mmm, I’ve heard it’s beautiful.
Well, we’re an Amazon family. Prime on both sides. NATHAN’S DAD Heaven's too expensive for me. I'll be stored on a sim card until these two finish their free version.
It won’t be long, if Nathan parties a little less and programs a little more. NATHAN’S MOM Pay him a salary, you can ask for a drug test.
Aw yiss, Mom!
Well, you’d all be welcome at Lakeview. It’s surprisingly affordable. Awkward beat. Nathan’s niece NEVAEH, 8, whispers in his e
Uncle Nathan, can you help me with my classical dance homework?

Nevaeh is TWERKING happily to “OMG” by Arash as Nathan mi riding her like a cowboy. DANCING MONTAGE: Nathan holds Nevaeh’s hands and spins he around. He glances in the mirror and fixes his hair. Neva slips out of his other hand and crashes into the wall.
Uncle Nathan!

Sorry! They keep twirling. Nevaeh is red in the face but loving Ingrid watches him dance with a smile, then checks her ph She catches Nathan’s eye and makes a “let’s go” face. INT. AMAZON OFFICE AREA —- BROOKLYN - DAY Nora walks past rows of desks, puts her coat on her chair and touches her ear. A little earbud blinks on and she he Beyoncé’s “Crazy in Love.” She waves at her terminal and screen lights up. Across the room, Nora’s supervisor, LUCY, looks at a map the workstations. Next to “Nora Antony” is a headset icon Lucy pokes it with her finger.
No music! The music stops.

Cool! Thanks so much, Lucy! Merry Winterday! She turns to her screen covered with folders and opens on labelled “Rechna Futawarab.” Inside is an avatar of a MID AGED INDIAN WOMAN next to a million video files and an al “rendering complete: activate?” Nora hits a key and a win opens with a jiggling brain wave and an upload circle tha starts filling up.
(into her headset) Hello, Rechna. (MORE )
I’m not expecting you to answer me yet, the system is sorting through a lot of information right now, but I’m gonna count to three, try to count with me. One... two... three.
(moaning) Oo-oh my God, where am I...?
It’s all good, Rechna. Welcome to Heaven.
Nathan and Ingrid finish making love, and she snuggles in him. Passing lights and advertising flicker on the ceilin REVEAL the bed is in Ingrid’s CAR.
Think they liked me?
Sure. You’re so fucking hot.
What?
Sorry, what'd you say?
Your family. Your mom said I was the first girl you ever brought home for Thanksgiving.
No big deal.
I think it is a big deal. I feel very special, babe.
++. Cool. HONK!! The car swerves, people outside curse, Nathan sits
Whoa, do you have “prioritize occupant” on?  10.
Of course. I care about us. You don't “prioritize pedestrian,” do you? He does. Ingrid notices something outside.

Park! INT./EXT. INGRID’S CAR POD - CONTINUOUS Ingrid’s car pulls over across from a little bodega calle “Whole Foods.” (For some reason, that chain has shrunk in the future.) Behind them, Nathan’s empty car pulls over t
Sleep over tonight?
Uh...
(sexy) I‘1l make it worth your while in the morning.
Okay.
Good. We need egg powder and a can of toast. EXT. INGRID’S CAR POD — CONTINUOUS Nathan enters the store. Her pod takes off, his waits.
Nathan pushes a cart down the freezer aisle.
(Australian accent) You lack iron. Buy some spinach.
A robot arm bags his groceries. Nathan pages through a tabloid on a screen.  11.

“Facebook/Panera Heaven Breaks First Weekend Attendance Records.” Videos show a Morongo-style hotel, with crowds gambling, learning to sexy dance, etc. INT. NATHAN’S CAR - SPEEDING - LATER PULL OUT to see the article is now on Nathan’s windshield

Panera went online with a record- breaking fifty million unique souls and visitors. The aggressive former-chain restaurant is on an acquisition tear, its stock soaring after rolling up Monsanto and Facebook earlier this year. Nathan suddenly notices his car is going fast and is HEAD STRAIGHT FOR a double-parked truck.
Car, see the parked truck?
No.
Yeah, it’s double parked.
Data shows no vehicles.
I’m looking right at a truck!
Could you be impaired by drugs? Again?
Fuck you! Manual override!
Manuel? There is no Manuel here. You are probably impaired.

Nathan CRASHES into the truck.  12. INT. NORA’S WORKSTATION - BROOKLYN - DAY Nora sucks an iced coffee from Dunkin Donuts, and works o new folder on her screen labelled “NATHAN BROWN.” She opens a video memory file to see... Nathan's POV: he happily dances with Nevaeh at Thanksgivi Nathan catches sight of himself in the mirror and grins. Nora pauses the image, then screenshots Nathan’s face and drags it to an empty wire frame animation, giving it a bl Nathan face. Lucy walks down the line of desks.
Anyone see my coffee order? Nora rotates her cup which says “Lucy” away as Lucy passe

Nope. She opens another memory file. Nathan's POV: the Pacific Coast Highway over the top of motorcycle handlebars, ocean on the left. Nathan looks in the side mirror and grins, the wind whipping his hair. Nora pauses the picture of Nathan checking his look in th mirror again. This guy just loves himself, doesn't he? Sh drags the image to the wire-frame avatar, which gets more detailed and high-res.
Ooh, young. A female co-worker looks over Nora’s shoulder. FEMALE CO-WORKER (CONT’D) And cute.
He sure thinks he’s cute. Basic Beverly Hills douche. App start- up? Vintage motorcycle? Come on.
I didn’t say have his baby, I'd just dance that pole. I’m in the wrong neighborhood -- my Nitely fucks all have less muscles and body hair than me... How’d he die?  13.
(looks at file) Car accident.
You mean motorcycle?
It says car.
Weird. I’m Uploading my fifth old woman in a row. Fun, huh?

Nora carefully edits Nathan’s hair on the avatar she is building, which is very detailed now. Using a stylus, she smooths out a cowlick. Perfect. She is very good at what she does. She looks at his handsome face for a beat, then mischievously “undos” the last few strokes until the cowl is back, and saves her work. She clicks on another memory file, but it doesn’t open. “MEMORY FILE A56F432C8 DAMAGED.” Nora frowns. That usuall doesn't happen. She starts a folder labelled “???” and dr the damaged file into it. She opens the next memory file. Nathan’s POV: lights pass by on a ceiling.
Chaos. Nathan is on a gurney being pushed into an OR wher team is working on him. Ingrid follows, freaking out.
Do you have any drug allergies, Nathan?
(voice is weird and whispery) No. I really think I’m okay.
When’s your birthday?
On the brif of Febinary.  14.
Oh, you’re not okay. God, I should have waited for you!
-.. Your teeth are so white.
Morphine has kicked in.
I’m going home. Nathan tries to stand up.
(another Australian female voice) Sit down please.
His vitals are dropping.
5 mgs epinephrine NOW.
Oh! We really want to Upload and I don’t want to miss the window.
Is the paperwork all filled out?
No.
Heaven sales rep to the ER.
Wait, what?
Just in case. Can't Upload a dead body.
Dead body?! I’m going to be fine.
Baby there's pieces of you sticking out all over the place!
Could someone call my folks? Vitals still dropping.  15.
They're on their way. Your Where is my surgical car called them after me. consult!? A man in a suit steps in holding a tablet.
Brand?
Amazon Lakeview please.
I want to request Neutral Storage, it’s a separate form.
Sorry. One at a time please. I need to start with an Amazon ID.
Ingrid Kannerman. Capital P panorama ampersand 2002.
Stand by on Upload Room 2.
Really don’t think we need Upload. I'm feeling pretty chill. INSERT SHOT: his vital signs dropping on the monitor.
His vitals are still going Another 3 mgs epinephrine. down. I’ve got OR 3 on hold also. Where is my consult?!?
Baby, don’t try and tough this out. You could just old-fashioned die, or we could be together forever.
Forever? Um. Honey you know I love you, you're amazing, but--
But what? Ingrid starts CRYING.  16.
If you’d rather die than be with me- - I just -- I --
Don’t cry. Please don’t cry. Ingrid cries harder. Nathan is aware of the sales rep. Me too!
There’s people... Now is so... (sigh) Of course I want to be with you,
there’s just a lot going on--
(thrusting tablet under Nathan’s hand) Great. Hit “accept.”
Wait, what am I accepting?
Our terms of service.
Which are?
You want to read it? It’s like two hundred pages.
I can’t sign without knowing what I'm signing.
Have you never gotten an app, ever? You can’t use the service without agreeing to the terms of service.
But that’s not fair. If I don’t use the service, I could be dead. I mean really dead dead. (it hits him) Disappear forever dead.
I would choose “agree” then.  17.
Fuuuuuuuck. INT. NORA’S WORKSTATION - BROOKLYN - DAY Nora watches the memory unfold with interest, loudly suck her drink down to the ice.
(to ER nurse) What are my chances here?
Your vitals keep dropping so unless your system rallies, you are currently dying of a punctured lung. I’m sorry.
This is insane, I’m only 27! They stop pushing the gurney because the hall splits into directions: left to Operating Rooms 1-4 and right to Uplo Rooms 1-3.
What do you want to do?
Sign the thing! Nathan motions to the Heaven Sales Rep to lean in.
There’s still sex, right?
Oh yeah. The VR suits are amazing. You can adjust her avatar, you can boost levels, stimulation you wouldn’t believe. Nathan nods and looks around.
Where’s my mom? I need to talk to her.
Eww gross.  18.
Not about that. God. His monitor beeps another warning. Ingrid gets on her kne and holds his hand like a demented proposal.
Nathan please. Say yes. I’m begging you, we’re out of time.
Ugh. Okay. Okay! He touches “ACCEPT” and they wheel him to the right.
This is going to be so great! Okay. Whatever. (overwhelmed) It’s only for eternity.
Nathan is strapped in a chair under a giant device that h from the ceiling.

This won't hurt. As soon as the shutters are up to speed, the scanner will start recording. I’m jealous man, Lakeview’s plush. See you on the other side. He exits. (ANGLE ON THE MONITOR: Unnoticed, Nathan’s VITA SIGNS start to GO BACK UP.) Nathan looks above him where a metal blade is starting to spin faster and faster.
(scared) Uh... Can we hit pause here?

Please look forward at the spot in front of you. Nathan looks at a “LOOK HERE” sign on the wall next to th window where Ingrid and the nurses are watching him. Thro the window, he sees his mom burst in the back of the room

Oh thank God. Mom--  19. Suddenly the Scan begins. A blinding WHITE LIGHT shines d on Nathan’s head, burning off one layer of molecules at a time, as a fan blows the ash of the already recorded laye out of the way. Quickly, Nathan’s HEAD FIZZLES down to his shoulders like burnt hair and the machine shuts off. His headless body, still with arm raised to his mom, fall into a cooler full of ice. As his mom and Ingrid SCREAM..
(Australian accent) Upload complete.
After a time...

Hello, Nathan. I’m not expecting you to answer me yet, the system is sorting through a lot of information, but I’m going to count to three, and try to count with me. One... two... three... INT. NORA’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Nora looks at a wave form of Nathan’s consciousness. Next it is a circle that is slowly filling up. (Another window scrolls through the millions of video files and photos. I complicated and cool as shit.)
Welcome to Heaven, Nathan.
You made it to Lakeview, you lucky duck.
(groans)
Hang in there, dude.  20. INT. NORA’S WORKSTATION —- CONTINUOUS Nora’s screen has Nathan’s brainwaves playing in a window
I want you to think of your self. The “I” in the sentence, “I think therefore I am.” Okay, cool, just gonna grab that... She highlights a section of his waveform with her cursor.
That’1l be your password, or passthought. I’11 always be able to use this to--

recognize you. Now, remember kindergarten? The alphabet song, A BCD? Think that for me... Yeah, good. Now think the color blue... white... red... yellow. Perfect. The darkness goes blue, then white, then red, then yellow then starts resolving slowly into a scene. INT. NORA’S WORKSTATION —- CONTINUOUS Nora looks at the screen.
(Australian female) I’m feeling pins and needles.
(laughs ) Why do people always set it for Australian accent? Say again please. She adjusts some stuff on the screen.
(regular voice) Pins and needles.
There we go. That’s a lot better voice for you.  21.
Yours is nice too. Nora rolls her eyes and ignores that.

Pins and needles is just the program finding your nerve endings. Can you see anything? INT. AMAZON LAKEVIEW — CONTINUOUS The place is booting up -- a rectangle becomes a window. Details emerge: a wooden rocking chair, a crocheted cushi porcelain door knobs. Out the window, brilliant blue sky, dark green fir trees on a distant mountain.
I’m in some kind of old-fashioned room... Nathan’s voice comes out of a simple male avatar with bro skin and hair, whose details are quickly getting filled i He looks out the window...
.--looking over a lake... Aaaannnd, he is completely detailed and HD.
..-beautiful trees... And, whoa! A shark swimming right towards me!
What?! That’s not supposed to--

(a little impressed) Ha! Sense of humor. Nice. Um, so, welcome to Amazon's Lakeview. The only digital afterlife environment modeled on the grand Victorian hotels of the United States and Canada.  22. Nathan looks around the room -- a big, luxurious, hotel s with a stuffed moose head and handmade wooden chairs with bark still on.
Hope it’s not too specific for you.
It was never my thing, but it’s kinda cool.

Yeah, our design team is brilliant. They took for inspiration the vacation spots of the Gilded Age millionaires, with a little Gatsby and Niagara Falls thrown in for fun. Timeless Americana, uplifting views, healthy pursuits. Good stuff.
Are there slaves?

What?! This is a design scheme, one, and that’s not even the right period, two. Lakeview is open to all races, religions, genders, absolutely anybody. I see you selected “non-denominational charismatic Christian” as your creed. That means, for you, the little chapel east of the hotel will be a Pentecostal Church. For someone else, the same building could be a mosque or even a bowling alley.
I’1l take the bowling alley.
I can make that change if you give me your Amazon ID.
BrunoMelrosel18.  23.
(typing) Your first dog and the street you grew up -- you used your porn name for an Amazon ID? Pretty poor security for a coder.
Excuse me?
Didn't work. Your charges are going to an Ingrid Kannerman.
Oh yeah.
There’re lots of free activities. Swim in the lake, hike up to a gazebo, take a class. Nathan’s face suddenly screws up and he chokes back tears
Uh oh. Dude, you okay?
(tearful) Yeah. I don’t know. No.

Don’t be embarrassed. It must be really hard. To die, I mean. Especially when you’re young, and handss - um, healthy. And remember, they saved your body so who knows? Maybe one day they figure out how to put you back in. Nora watches with compassion as Nathan sucks it back up a composes himself.
Thanks. What’s your name?
Well, you’re supposed to just refer to me as your “Angel.”
Oh. Are you dead too, or alive? Or just artificial intelligence?  24.
I’m not allowed to say. Sorry. But anytime you need me I’1l be here for you. Just ask and I'll be right in your ear.
Okay... Angel. Nora, privately, realizes she likes having this handsome call her “angel.” Before the pause turns into a moment...
(back on script) So you’re all connected now. Do you look real to yourself? Ten fingers and toes? He wiggles them.
Yeah, pretty seamless.
Explore, enjoy, meet your fellow Uploads. This is the first day of the rest of your afterlife.

Got it. OK. Sounds good. He gives a brave thumbs up. Nora touches her screen and i suddenly looking at 48 little windows with other clients them. She takes off her headset and rubs her temples. She finds she is still watching Nathan in his small window. She watches as he goes to the window, closes the shades a curls up in bed. Wait, is he crying? She touches the screen to make it go full screen again, a watches Nathan grieve.
(gently) Hey, this was a big day. You died and were reborn, so a lot to process.
Yeah.
Tomorrow’ll be better, you’ll see. Get some rest.  25.

Ugh, there’s no way I’m going to fall asl-- Nora drags down a setting bar on her screen and Nathan is instantly asleep. She watches him for a beat, then types something on her keyboard, and a blanket covers him. INT. NATHAN’S SUITE - LAKEVIEW - NEXT MORNING Nathan wakes up, sunshine streaming in his window. He stretches and looks around. Not terrible. INT. NATHAN’S BATHROOM He takes a long shower with great water pressure.

Oh yiss! Oh my god, yes!! INT. NATHAN’S BATHROOM - LATER Nathan combs his hair but can’t get rid of the cowlick. INT. NATHAN’S SUITE - KITCHENETTE - CONTINUOUS He walks into a kitchenette and opens the fridge. NATHAN’S POV The fridge is only stocked with drinks. A sign appears in air: “swipe left.” He swipes and the drinks slide away, revealing a fridge interior full of fruit. He swipes a couple more times until he sees a bunch of hot coffees. H tries to take out a coffee cup of steaming hot coffee. Another sign appears in the air: “IN-APP PURCHASE. Enter your Amazon ID and you will be charged $1.99.”
Angel?
Yes, Nathan? Nathan jumps. Behind him is a STUDLY MAN WITH ANGEL WINGS
Yo, what the--? where did you--?  26.
Ha ha ha. Don’t freak.
The Male Angel, a much shlubbier guy in real life, sits a his work station, with a Virtual Reality box on his face.
It’s just VR so I can visit in person. You good? INT. NATHAN’S SUITE - CONTINUOUS
What happened to the one from last night?
Not her shift yet. Want a coffee?
Maybe something stronger. Genie, a Moscow Mule please.
Ha ha ha. But really, we have them on screen 27.
.-. Nah. It’s okay.

No problem. Later gater. He disappears. How weird. EXT. NATHAN’S BALCONY - MOMENTS LATER Nathan goes out on the balcony and sees a BEAUTIFUL LAKE pine-clad mountains across the water. A couple (ZACH and BARBARA) sit holding hands in Adironda chairs on the balcony next to his.
Hey newbie.
Hey.  27.
Settling in okay?
Yeah. Are you both...?
Dead? Yup. But thank God we both had time for Upload.
High school sweethearts. First woman I ever kissed.
Aww, soulmates. That’s awesome.
That’s what it’s all about. Love beats death, two zip.
Cute. So, Upload, huh? (slaps his chest, deep breath) I feel completely real and alive. The programming depth is insane. And I’m a coder.
Oh, what do you program?
(trying to remember) Uh... different things.
Good! Gonna go for a hike?
Maybe after breakfast. If I don’t want to use the minibar, is there a breakfast that’s included, or...?
Yes, in the dining hall, for another 20 minutes. It’s amazing. They’ve got maple bacon donuts.
D’oh! Right? (off their stare) Simpsons? (mutters to himself) (MORE )

It’s only been on the air for 57 years. INT. LAKEVIEW - HALL. 28. Nathan goes out his front door (Suite 10556) and is in a hall. He walks past other doors looking for the elevators INT. LAKEVIEW —- ELEVATOR He gets on an elevator with a woman who looks 18, but wea clothes from the 1960s, and is only in black-and-white. stares at her...
Can I help you?
Sorry. This is my first day.
Oh! You’re wondering about my avatar. I turn a hundred next month, but I used a photo of me from 1961, although it might be my sister.
Is your last name Kannerman by any chance?
Yes it is. Mildred Kannerman.
I’m going to your birthday party. I’m Ingrid’s boyfriend.
Oh, honey, I hadn’t heard. I’m so sorry. Oh, poor Ingrid. This is really too bad. The elevator stops at her floor.
That’s me. 10,300. (she stares at him) This is really too bad. She gets off, leaving him a bit thrown. He  29.
Nathan walks past a CONCIERGE DESK with a line of people. GUY WITH A CHEERFUL GRIN (DAN) is offering them GUM.

Gum? Orbit Gum? Piece of gum? Piece of Orbit Spearmint gum? Sugar free? Piece of Orbit’s new Wintergreen Wonderland flavor-fixed gum with healthy Sorbitol? People scowl and push him out of the way. A guy takes a piece and “0.75” floats over his head and evaporates. Nathan follows a sign for “Dining Hall.” He opens his fingers and his screen appears.
Ingrid. Facetime request connects. (Nathan talks as he walks thro the public areas of Lakeview.) Ingrid looks flushed and dressed up, a lot of people behind her.
Yes!! Hi there! How's it going?
(thrown) Uh, it’s okay. Where'd I get you?
At a friend’s. So? Is it amazing? Do you feel like yourself? Was it scary? Do you love it?
Yeah, it’s really cool. I mean, I'd rather be alive, obviously. I met your grandma.
I know! She texted me. She said you were cute but a little lost.
Both true. (beat) I miss you.  30.
Yeah. I miss you too. Everybody's been all, I’m so sorry your boyfriend died. I miss your body.
Aww. I miss my hair. There’s something off about my hair now.
Yeah, looks different. Hair is probably hard to program.
Tell me about it. They look at each other awkwardly.
Is this weird?
We'll get used to it.
Pretend I’m on a business trip.
For the next 50 years until I can join you. 60 if I eat right.
Then don’t.
I had ice cream for breakfast.
That’s so hot. Hey, so can I get your Amazon password? I can’t charge anything to my account here.
Yeah, we used my account in the ER.
I guess I need your password then.
Well, I set something up where I get a text alert when you want to charge something. I like knowing what you’re up to. (MORE )
Makes me feel closer to you. Hey! Show me the lake! Nathan points his screen towards the window across the po
Fucking gorgeous, babe! WOMAN (0.S. Ing! Ohmygod, I’m so sorry!
(turns to someone offscreen) Theng you! Ohmigod, I probably look like a fucking wreck right now, it’s been so difficult-- WOMAN (0.S. No you look strong like a goddess, like a hot survivor.
Theng you! (whispering to Nathan) Baby, I ran into my pube stylist, I gotta drone.
But you don’t have any pubes.
I know, she’s amazing. I/’11 call you later. If you need anything I am here for you. Utterly. Love you.
Love you too.

Nora in a graduation gown between her smiling parents. INT. DAVE ANTONY’S HOUSE - CITY ISLAND - EVENING - CONTIN Nora looks at the photo wistfully. In the background, her Dad, DAVE, is in his kitchen.  32.

Hope you're hungry! I printed a steak design Jamie Oliver tweeted this morning. A 3D printer finishes two plates of dinner, layer by laye DAVE ANTONY (CONT’D) Oliver’s only on Google/Samsung so I know you didn’t have this for lunch. He brings the food to a table set for two.
Speaking of work, Dad...
(cautious) O-kay.
We've had a ton of upgrades lately. With my employee discount, it’d be smart to lock in such a good deal-- Dave stifles a coughing fit. Nora looks on, concerned.
Dad... After his coughs subside--
Sorry, honey. No go.
I could be your angel, we could hang out--
I can’t. Mom is waiting for me.
C'mon! You don’t believe that old stuff!

It doesn't make any sense, but it’s how I feel. How could Heaven not have your mother in it? He looks at her with a sad smile. Nora sighs and goes bac to her dinner.  33. DAVE ANTONY (CONT’D) How’s the steak?
I think your fat cartridge might be low.
Yeah, it’s terrible.
The grand dining hall with a view of the lake and mountai is full of Uploads. A sign says “Breakfast served 6 - 10a Nathan starts loading a plate with treats from the buffet
Oh my god. This is amazing! Bacon and Canadian bacon. Chocolate chip pancakes. Noice!
Ten o'clock. Breakfast is over. All the food in the dining hall and on his plate disappea
What?! Aww! A disheveled angry guy (LUKE) rushes in and takes in the emptiness.

FUCK! Fuckity fuck fuck fuck. He heads over to one of those industrial milk dispensers rubber tubes coming out the bottom, and opens and slams t door five times fast. A dinner roll appears in an empty bread basket. He scarfs the roll then does it again. Nath walks over.
Can I try? Luke nods and Nathan slams the door to get a free roll.
Useful glitch. I don’t know why I'm feeling hungry at all, I mean, there’s no need to eat, right?  34.
The first Uploads didn’t shit or eat, didn’t even have eyelids. They all went psychotic in a week. Luke rapidly slams the milk door.

You gotta believe it’s real. When the weirdness gets in your head, guys are drawn to the torrent. He points out the window to the far end of the lake at a waterfall. Close up: THE DATA TORRENT. A rushing column of plasma wi steam boiling off it. Oddly beautiful and powerful, like Niagara Falls.
That’s the data stream between here and the real world. Poor bastards jump in to try to get back.
Can they?

Nah, they get blown to bits. My angel has me working on deep breathing and meditation to keep me “here and now,” stay connected. Of course, stuff like hot rolls magically appearing when you slam a milk door doesn’t help.
Tasty, though. They each munch a roll and grin.
Hey I’m Nathan. This is my first day.
Luke. How'd you buy it?
My self-driving car crashed.
Ha! They’re supposed to be foolproof.  35.
Guess it wasn’t. How about you?
Lost my legs in Iran and spent five years in a wheelchair. Then one day I wheeled my ass under a scanner.
(sober ) Oh. Suiscan.
Yeah. But look what I’m working with now! He does a crazy little jig, gesturing to his legs.
Right on!
Nathan stands in front of a urinal, a stream of pee going Something looks “off” to him. Experimentally, he twists h pelvis. The pee stream bends in mid air and still ends up perfectly in the urinal.

Ha ha. Awesome. QUICK MONTAGE of Nathan peeing sideways, peeing behind himself, peeing out the window. In all cases, the stream curves and shoots directly into the urinal. INT. NORA’S APARTMENT - QUEENS, NY - BATHROOM Nora’s in the shower, under a horrible low-flo dribble. MANDI, Nora’s roommate, holds up a fitband that’s on a pi of Nora’s clothes.
Can I check Nitely on your phone?

Be my guest. I am so done with that app. Well, almost done. Mandi snaps the fitband on her wrist and opens her thumb finger, making the screen appear. She swipes through Nite looking at profiles.  36.

It’s proven to know you better than you know yourself, they invested a billion dollars in the algorithm. (seeing a cool profile) Ooh, they’re matching you with some real hotties. I get nothing but bus boys and meth addicts.
I thought you said the algorithm was good.
Yeah, I deserve a meth addict.
Oh Mandi.
Ah, he was fun, he was up for anything. And the lack of teeth proved to be pretty bomb actually. He gummed me until I screamed.
Nathan goes for a hike around the lake. It is really beautiful. He smiles at other scans as he walks.
Morning! Good day!
He comes upon a resort map on a signpost. Next to it, LOU CRUZ, fat, 40s, is talking into an Ansel Adams-style box camera on a tripod.

Hey guys, its Lou Crayz, whassup? Coming at you live from Lakeview. So... I really like this view of the lake, it’s one of my faves. They’ve spent beaucoup bucks on getting the view absolutely right. It’s Lakey as hell. The waterfeel is more meh. Kind of grainy, and the sun on the ripples is a repeating gif but it repeats too fast to be really mwah! That’s all for now. Like, comment, subscribe!  37. Louie starts packing up his camera.
Hey I’ve seen the ads for a Lakeview V-cation, where is everybody? I thought this was a super popular place for Weekend Gigaways.
They’re all here. You only see 5 floors at a time. Like what is your suite number?

OK, you’re on the ten thousand five hundredth floor. Living people on V-cation are floors 1 to 5,000. You don’t want to go down there, it smells like a Senor Frog's. Everything over 5,000 is Heaven, permanent residents. He pinches the resort map and expands the picture of the hotel. It stretches 10,000 floors into the sky. LOUIE CRUZ (CONT’D) We all use the same map. There’s millions of people swimming in the pool right now. You can tell cause the frame rate drops. He points to a guy diving off the diving board. The guy enters the water in jerky increments.

Whoa. INT. NORA’S TINY APARTMENT - NIGHT CLOSE ON a Kindle-like device with a “Queens Public Libra bar code. REVEAL it’s connected to a VR headset that Nora wears, sitting up in bed. IN NORA’S VIRTUAL REALITY - HAWAII, 2004 - CONTINUOUS A scene from the Adam Sandler/Drew Barrymore romantic com 50 First Dates, only Drew Barrymore has been removed and is in the film, walking to her car with young Adam Sandle after eating breakfast. They are both being very flirty.
And the real cool thing about walruses is they’re very mysterious.
Mysterious?
Yeah, yeah, we really don’t know what they’re like in the wild.
They don’t just sleep on icebergs and yawn all the time?
Yeah that’s all we really see that they do outside of the water. There hasn’t been much research on what they do under the ice, which is where they spend two thirds of their lives.
Well maybe they’re just down there intimidating the other sea creatures with their big winkies.

That is one theory. They both laugh. INT. NORA’S TINY APARTMENT —- CONTINUOUS Nora sits alone in her bed lost in VR. Reveal on the othe side of the room: Mandi is having LOUD SEX with some scra dude with bad teeth.
Nathan walks up to a magnificent tree next to a hedge. He pulls off a few leaves and looks at them. They are all copies of the same leaf.
(disappointed) Hmm. Cut and paste. Suddenly a tennis ball flies over the top.  39.

Ball! Nathan picks it up and looks over the hedge. NATHAN’S POV An 11-year-old boy, DYLAN MCNAB, sits in the middle of A VOID. The hedge was the border of what was programmed, an past it is... nothing.
Agh! Get down from there!

Calm down. It’s okay. Nathan gingerly climbs over and slides to Dylan like a gu walking on thin ice. Dylan takes the ball and begins bouncing it against the back of the hedge and catching it Nathan looks down into the void, then back at Lakeview.
This is fucking weird.
It’s nice. Like being nowhere. Sometimes I can’t take it anymore, you know?
Are your parents here too?
No, I fell off a cliff at the Grand Canyon. My mom says I was a handful. (squints at Nathan's hair) Are you wearing a wig?
(self-consciously running fingers through hair) No. God, no. This isn’t my normal hair. They like programmed it really wavy or something. It’s driving me nuts.
Yeah, well--  40.
At home I used a Natural Sculpting Creme and an anti-frizz Pomade, but here... (shrugs ) You're at their mercy, I guess.
Well, that’s--
Pff. Wig! Kid, you’re hilarious!
Nora gets out of the elevator with her messenger bag. The schlubby male angel, IVAN, is getting on to leave.
Hey. Nora nods hello. Ivan wedges his foot in the elevator doo IVAN (CONT’D) Hey, I got a friend who’s having a party in a sick loft Friday night. He’s got about a thousand Fentanyl. I've seen ‘em.
Yeah, no that’s not for me.
You should go out sometime. Get fucked up, have some fun.
I go out plenty. Just not gonna be tripping with you in some loft. I’m not there yet.

Too good for that huh? Don’t wait too long. This offer isn’t open forever. He lets the doors close.  41. INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM - LAKEVIEW LATER Nathan picks up a remote and browses a screen that says “Entertainment.” He selects “Classic TV” then “Game of Thrones” and a sign appears: In-App Purchase, $4.99. He tries “Fargo”: In-App Purchase, $4.99. He selects “2 Brok Girls: FREE.” He turns it off. He opens his hand to call Ingrid but it goes straight to voicemail.
Hey it’s Ingrid, I’m either out or busy right now, but I’1l-- Nathan breaks it off. He starts pacing.
I am so lucky. People save their whole lives for this. EXT. NATHAN’S BALCONY - MOMENTS LATER He stands on the balcony taking in the beautiful view and breathing heavily.
Nngg, nggg, calm down, buddy. A banner ad appears on a cloud: “You recently searched ‘Fargo: Season One.’ Purchase in HD for $49.99?”
Nngg, nngg. INT. NATHAN’S BATHROOM - LAKEVIEW - MOMENTS LATER He stares at himself in the mirror. He tries to fix the cowlick, but it bounces back.
It’s all good. Gonna live forever. He smiles into the mirror. After a beat, he tries to rip cowlick out of his head with both hands.
Nora is in a stall, sitting on the toilet and looking at memes on her hand-screen.  42.
Nora, are you in here? Nora says nothing.
Um, your new boy is freaking out. The hot dude. He’s hiking up near the torrent.
Shit. Thanks!
Nora runs to her desk and grabs her VR mask. She glances her screen.
Shit shit.

Nathan walks towards the waterfall, passing signs “Data torrent ahead. Do not approach.” and “Avatars, AIs, Uploa go no further. The data torrent will deliminate you into undifferentiated data bits.” Nora appears behind him.
Hey, Nathan, wait up! He recognizes her voice.
Oh, it’s your shift now? You know you work for a really fucked up thing. This is a bad idea. The ads make it look great, but it’s fucking... monstrous.
So maybe not the best first day.

Day? There’s no day, there’s no night, there’s no dirt, there’s no rain, there’re no bad smells. I farted, which is already like, why? just a weird detail, and it was like someone spritzed the room with cologne.  43.
It’s supposed to be Heaven.
How is that Heaven?
Well, maybe not for you, but if you were stuck in an elevator with another guest...
Uh huh. I just want to look over the edge there. Maybe I can see home.
You realize if you jump into that thing, you don’t go anywhere, you just disappear. And there’s nothing left to rescan.
Maybe that’s just my tough luck, but it’s how it’s supposed to go down.
Oo-oh. So you agree with Neil Beagley.
Who’s that?

He was a 16 year old boy who died of a uti ‘cause he refused medical treatment for religious reasons. Or the parents of Wesley Parker who let him die age 11 while they sang hymns instead of giving him insulin. You agree with them?
No, that’s fucked up.
Exactly.
But I did die.
What was the first thing I asked you to think of?
My a-b-c’s?

No, your self. I think therefore I am. That is still you, it has always been you, it will always be you as long as it can still be aware of itself. That’s consciousness and that’s what we’re in the business of keeping going. Why do you think it’s sometimes weird and unnatural here? Because your consciousness is thinking and comparing with your memories -- that’s you, baby. Doing what you you always did. Thinking and being alive. And I’m sure there are plenty of people, including me for one, that are glad you're still here.
You don’t even know me.

Not yet. But I’d like to. And I get this isn’t perfect, and maybe you were led to believe it would be since the marketing mentions Heaven like a dozen times, but it’s kind of better isn’t it? Maybe the imperfections make it more like Life, ‘cause Life isn’t perfect, but Life is the most magical gift there is. If there’s God, he’s amazing because he gave us Life, and the gratitude and creativity to keep it going as long as we possibly can.
(beat) You’re good.
Yeah.  45.

(examines her) You're a living person. AI doesn’t talk like that, with passion and... pain. Soul. Something’s going on with you, in your life. This isn’t just about one of your clients. This is about you, saving people.
Maybe.
Is this what you look like for real? You’re not an old woman or a dude or something?
This is me. (suddenly self conscious) I mean, my avatar has make-up on and my hair is nice, and I’m not in sweatpants, so it’s a little better than normal, but nothing else is tweaked.
Good for you then. (matter of fact) You're really pretty. Nora takes this in.
But I’m not allowed to know your name.
No. I could get in trouble. It’s a policy.
(disappointed) Okay. Nora makes a decision.
My name is Nora. I live in Ozone Park, Queens. My apartment’s about as big as your bathroom, but I’m at work now which is in Dumbo, Brooklyn. (MORE )
It’s a really humid day and the bitch a couple desks down is taking forever to eat a tuna sandwich that I’m considering chucking out the window. Nora Antony.
Nice to meet you.
Likewise. Can we go home now?
Okay. They start to walk down the path back to the hotel. We se them from behind. After a beat...
What’s your favorite smell?
I don’t know. Fresh baked bread, right out of the oven? They walk for another couple steps, then Nora shakes her out and farts at him.
Eww, you weirdo.
Smell it. He takes a deep breath, closes his eyes and smiles.
Mmmmmm. You genius.
